com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step

Class ColumnManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step.ColumnManager

  • public class ColumnManager
extends Object
    Represents a list of a step's outputColumns, and exposes methods to aid the manipulation of them. Note: The columns can be further manipulated by the user through the UI, although that manipulation is always performed AFTER the step's output columns are defined, and relies on a fixed and known set of output outputColumns.

    • Constructor Summary

      protected ColumnManager()
      Create a ColumnManager with no columns

      Constructor that initialises the output outputColumns from one or more inputs

    • Method Detail

      • setColumnsFromInput

        public final void setColumnsFromInput(StepOutput input)
        Reset the output outputColumns to those contained within one input
        Parameters:
        input - The input step whose outputColumns become the output outputColumns

      • getColumnNames

        Returns:

        Get a list of the outputColumns being output.
        Returns:
        A list of StepColumn objects.

      • reorderColumns

        public final void reorderColumns(List<String> columnNames)
        Re-order the outputColumns using a list of their names. If a given column name does not match, it will be ignored. ColumnManager not included in the list of names will be removed.
        Parameters:
        columnNames - A list of Strings corresponding to the names of the outputColumns stored in this object

      • setOutputColumns

        public final void setOutputColumns(List<StepColumn> outputColumns)
        Set the outputColumns defined in this object. Removes all prior outputColumns.
        Parameters:
        outputColumns - A list of StepColumn objects

      • clearColumns

        public final void clearColumns()
        Removes all output outputColumns from this object

      • removeColumn

        public final StepColumn removeColumn(String columnName)
        Removes a column from the list of output outputColumns
        Parameters:
        columnName - A String containing the name of the column
        Returns:
        The StepColumn removed, or null if not found

      • addColumn

        public final StepColumn addColumn(StepOutput step,
                                  String name,
                                  String description)
        Create a new custom column and add it to the list of output columns. Custom columns' values will be obtained from the custom view
        Parameters:
        step - The stepOutput object that will handle getting the value for the column
        name - The name of the column
        description - The description of the column
        Returns:
        The newly created StepColumn, or null if failed

      • addColumnAt

        public final StepColumn addColumnAt(StepOutput step,
                                    String name,
                                    String description,
                                    int position)
        Create a new custom column and add it to the list of output columns at the position indicated.
        Parameters:
        step - The stepOutput object that will handle getting the value for the column
        name - The name of the column
        description - The description of the column
        position - The position in the output column list to insert the new column where 0 indicates first column.
        Returns:
        The newly created StepColumn, or null if failed

      • moveColumnTo

        public final void moveColumnTo(String columnName,
                               int position)
        Moves an existing output column to a new position. If the column cannot be found, nothing will happen.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The name of the column to move
        position - The new position in the list

      • moveColumnTo

        public final void moveColumnTo(StepColumn column,
                               int position)
        Moves an existing output column to a new position.
        Parameters:
        column - Moves an existing column to a new position.
        position - The new position in the output list

      • findAllColumnsWithName

        public final List<StepColumn> findAllColumnsWithName(String name)
        Finds all output columns that match the given name. This will typically only be required when the step has multiple inputs.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the column
        Returns:
        A list of StepColumn objects

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getValue

        public final Object getValue(String columnName,
                             long row)
                      throws Exception
        Finds the column by name and gets the value at the given row. If the column is not found, null will be returned. If there is an error getting the value this function will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The name of the column
        row - The row of the value
        Returns:
        The value object found at the given row for the column
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown if an error is thrown whilst getting the value.

      • getInputColumnsWithTag

        public List<StepColumn> getInputColumnsWithTag(StepOutput input,
                                               String tag)
        Returns all Columns in input that are tagged with the given tag name
        Parameters:
        input - - the input dataset
        tag - - the name of the data tag
        Returns:
        a list of columns
